trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of objects.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection> class represents a collection of objects arranged on a design surface or inside a parent <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ContainerControl?displayProperty=fullName>.

There are no publicly defined constructors in <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection> because it is designed to be used only internally within the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].

However, classes derived from <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection>, such as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection?displayProperty=fullName>, are available to the developer.
Copies the entire contents of this collection to a compatible one-dimensional <xref href="System.Array"></xref>, starting at the specified index of the target array.
The type of the specified array must be compatible with the source collection.
This method uses the <xref:System.Array.Copy%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to copy the elements.
The one-dimensional <xref href="System.Array"></xref> that is the destination of the elements copied from the current collection.
The array must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.
array is `null`.
index is less than 0.
array is multidimensional.
-or-
The number of elements in the source collection is greater than the available space from index to the end of array.
The type of the source element cannot be cast automatically to the type of array.
Gets the number of elements in the collection.
When required, the capacity of the collection will dynamically increase to accept more elements.
The number of elements currently contained in the collection.
Determines whether two <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection"></xref> instances are equal.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection"></xref> to compare with the current <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection"></xref>.

`true` if the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection"></xref> is equal to the current <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Returns an enumerator for the entire collection.
Typically the enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure.
Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads could still modify the collection, which causes the enumerator to throw an exception.
To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can follow one of the following strategies:
Lock the collection during the entire enumeration using a <xref:System.Threading.Monitor>.
Catch and handle the exceptions that result from changes made by other threads.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> for the entire collection.
Returns the hash code for this instance.
A hash code for the current <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection"></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the collection is read-only.
A read-only collection does not allow the addition, removal, or modification of elements after the collection is created.
A read-only collection is simply a collection with a wrapper that prevents modifying the collection.
If changes are made to the underlying collection, the read-only collection reflects those changes.
`true` if the collection is read-only; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
For a description of this member, see the <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized"></xref> property.
This method is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
`true` if access to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection"></xref> is synchronized (thread safe); otherwise, `false`.
For a description of this member, see the <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot"></xref> property.
This method is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
An object that can be used to synchronize access to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection"></xref>.
For a description of this member, see the <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Add(System.Object)"></xref> method.
This method is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to add to the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref>.
The position into which the new element was inserted.
For a description of this member, see the <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Clear"></xref> method.
This method is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
For a description of this member, see the <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Contains(System.Object)"></xref> method.
This method is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to locate in the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref>.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Object"></xref> is found in the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
For a description of this member, see the <xref href="System.Collections.IList.IndexOf(System.Object)"></xref> method.
This method is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to locate in the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref>.
The index of value if found in the list; otherwise, -1.
For a description of this member, see the <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Insert(System.Int32,System.Object)"></xref> method.
This method is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The zero-based index at which value should be inserted.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to insert into the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref>.
For a description of this member, see the <xref href="System.Collections.IList.IsFixedSize"></xref> property.
This method is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref> has a fixed size; otherwise, `false`.
For a description of this member, see the <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Item(System.Int32)"></xref> property.
This method is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The zero-based index of the element to get.
The element at the specified index.
For a description of this member, see the <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Remove(System.Object)"></xref> method.
This method is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to remove from the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref>.
For a description of this member, see the <xref href="System.Collections.IList.RemoveAt(System.Int32)"></xref> method.
This method is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The zero-based index of the item to remove.
